alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Jackson; Madison; Marshall; Morgan (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 06 at 3:28PM CDT until August 06 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Huntsville Alabama has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Marshall County in northeastern Alabama... Jackson County in northeastern Alabama... Madison County in north central Alabama... Southwestern DeKalb County in northeastern Alabama... Southeastern Morgan County in north central Alabama... * Until 415 PM CDT. * At 327 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Madison to near Gurley to Arab, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. This storm has a history of producing widespread wind damage and is also producing frequent lightning. Move indoors if outside! IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Huntsville, Madison, Albertville, Scottsboro, Boaz, Guntersville, Arab, Rainsville, Moores Mill and Meridianville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
